name: Pesto Genovese
description: /'Genoese grounded paste'/ Although the first written recipe dates to 1852, very similar dishes can be found dating back to Roman times, but closer enactments were more prevalent in the Liguria region.
instructions: Blend ingredients together until it forms a green paste and save in an airtight container
Boil the pasta, dry out and mix with the pesto.
variants: Substitute the pine nuts for pistachios or walnuts.

culinary: The more slender of a container, the better, as it reduces the area of pesto in contact with the air.
I find that pesto improves on the day after. After that it's worse however: it slowly oxidizes and loses color.
Use only basil leaves. The stems would leave annoying fibrous strands.
